title: Flooding From Snow Melt Expected In Buffalo
teaser: Temperatures are climbing to nearly 60 degrees in Buffalo today, where nearly 7 feet of snow fell in some parts of the city last week.
contentencoded:
Nearly 7 feet of snow fell in some parts of Buffalo, N.Y. last week, and much of it is now melting, as temperatures are reaching nearly 60 degrees today.

Residents in flood-prone areas are preparing to evacuate. High winds are also expected to topple trees weighed down by heavy snow. WBFO news director Brian Meyer joins Here & Now’s Robin Young with the latest.

Guest

  • Brian Meyer, news director at WBFO He tweets @BrianMeyerWBFO.
